summary: "invalid property id" errors using reserved names as IdentifierNames

comments.content: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. use a reserved word as an IdentifierName (vs Identifier) i.e. a={class: 123, import: "abc"} 2. compile What is the expected output? What do you see instead? As "class" and "import" are used as an IdentifierNames and NOT as as Identifiers (as described in es5.github.com/#A.1). Still the Closure Compiler returns "JSC_PARSE_ERROR: Parse error. invalid property id at line 1 character 3" It should be completely valid and works (at least) in FF 17 and Chrome 23 and IE 10. A example similar to the one above is provided by Mozilla https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/JavaScript/Reference/Reserved_Words

Closure Compiler defaults to ES3
http://code.google.com/p/closure-compiler/wiki/JavaScript

the es5.github.com spec you're pointing at is for ES5. If you want to use ES5, you can use the --language_in=ECMASCRIPT5 flag
